text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I want
to share with you a recipe for Lemon
Poppyseed cookies now I've actually
gotten quite a few requests for these
recently and I've seen the requests pop
up and I was like oh that's such a
brilliant idea because I know I and I
think a lot of people love lemon poppy
seed muffins which I have done a recipe
in Laura in the kitchen so you can go to
my website to go search stuff to get
that one but I'm not made the cookie
version so I thought that's wonderful
and it's so cold and rainy and icy and
snowy that this little bit of a lemon
flavor is gonna really brighten your day
and I feel like I would really love to
make a lemon berry tart right now but
nothing is really in season and fresh
and juicy so I'm gonna settle for lemon
cookie that you're gonna love so let me
run you through the list of ingredients
short and sweet kind of like me I've got
some butter that's been softened at room
temperature I've just been sitting in on
my stove because I've got the oven on
for something else I need sugar poppy
seeds flour baking soda baking powder
and salt
you need some eggs and you will need
some lemon that's really it it's really
simple and easy what I'm going to do is
I'm going to unite the sugar and the
butter and using a handheld whisk I'm
just gonna cream these together really
really really really well and then I'll
show you the next step it's gonna add my
eggs and get those well combined now
before I add in my dry ingredients
I want the zest and the juice of a whole
big fat lemon I'm looking for about a
tablespoon and a half of the juice and
about I would say a scant tablespoon of
the zest is it's gonna give you the
lovely lovely flavor really bright
really delicious it's gonna pair a
fantastic with the poppy seeds I'm gonna
add it at this stage and then combine it
together and scrape the sides of the
bowl with my spatula because once I add
the dry ingredients I'm just gonna use a
spatula to fold everything together it's
just sort of it's nice and easy so go
ahead and do that or it already smells
so good
so fresh
and so bright all right I added the zest
in the juice I'm just gonna combine this
part really quickly all right now
I'm going to switch to my handheld
spatula and just combine all of the dry
ingredients together give the drying
greens just a quick little mixer ooh
before you add them in and now I'm just
patiently combine it all together that
looks perfect now what I'm going to do
and this is important you have to pop
this into the fridge for about 45
minutes or so and then we're gonna go
ahead and form our cookies and bake them
and they're gonna be perfection so I'm
just gonna cover this pop them in the
fridge and I'll show you the rest right
my cookie dome was in the fridge for
almost an hour and it is perfect I've
got my oven preheated to 350 I've got a
baking sheet here lined with parchment
paper and I'm just going to form them
using my handy dandy ice cream scoop
make sure that you place them a couple
inches apart from each other I'm not
gonna bake all of them today because hey
I will eat them all and be like most
cookie dough's they last so great the
dough lasts so great in the fridge for
like a week or so if not longer and even
longer than that
in the freezer so I'm just gonna keep
the dough on hand just because we've
been having like people stop by stuff a
lot more during the week especially so
it's nice to be able to pop something
into the oven that's nice and fresh and
warm last minute so I'm just gonna form
all of my cookies and then I'm gonna pop
them into my oven for 8 to 10 minutes or
until a lovely light golden color around
the edges and then we'll let them cool
and I will show you what they look like
when they are all done my cookies were
in the oven for exactly 10 minutes at
350 and I took them out and place them
on a cooling rack to finish cooling
completely and they smell so good and
now that just need a little kiss of
powdered sugar because you know sugar
makes everything better
I'll be honest here let's be let's be
for real and these two stuck together as
you can see so I'll just take this one
look how perfect the bottom is let
lightly golden brown
that is your best you know what think of
this a soft sugar cookie but better
that's what this is it's not dry and
really hard and crispy it's a little
crispy around the edges with a little
beautiful was like a perfect chew in the
middle if that makes any sense if you
love a good cookie you know what I'm
talking about
go to laurainthekitchen.com get the
